metadata.Title: CVE-2020-9543 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium
metadata.Description:
OpenStack Manila <7.4.1, >=8.0.0 <8.1.1, and >=9.0.0 <9.1.1 allowsattackers to view, update, delete, or share resources that do not belong tothem, because of a context-free lookup of a UUID. Attackers may also createresources, such as shared file systems and groups of shares on such sharenetworks.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-9543` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

manila-api - 1:10.0.0~b3~git2020032516.cb016333-0ubuntu1
manila-common - 1:10.0.0~b3~git2020032516.cb016333-0ubuntu1
manila-data - 1:10.0.0~b3~git2020032516.cb016333-0ubuntu1
manila-scheduler - 1:10.0.0~b3~git2020032516.cb016333-0ubuntu1
manila-share - 1:10.0.0~b3~git2020032516.cb016333-0ubuntu1
python3-manila - 1:10.0.0~b3~git2020032516.cb016333-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: manila package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:10.0.0~b3~git2020032516.cb016333-0ubuntu1').
